Legal_Issue: Whether the Officer breached the duty of fairness by failing to provide adequate notice for submitting updated evidence
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), sections related to H&C considerations
Application_Facts: Applicant did not receive a letter requesting updated information; no trackable method used for sending communication; decision made without considering new family circumstances in Armenia
Decision_Outcome: H&C application denied due to lack of updated evidence
Court_Ruling: Breach of duty of fairness found; decision set aside and referred for redetermination by a different panel
Claimant_Status: Applicant in Canada seeking H&C relief based on family ties and humanitarian grounds
Defendant_Behavior: Failure to use verifiable method to send request for updated evidence; decision made without ensuring applicant had opportunity to respond
Grounds_for_Claim: Lack of procedural fairness, inadequate notice, failure to consider material changes in family situation
Legal_Standard: Duty of fairness in administrative decision-making
Assessment_Factor: Opportunity to present evidence, timeliness and method of communication, significance of updated family circumstances
Procedural_Issue: Absence of proof that notice was effectively communicated to the applicant
Review_Standard: Reasonableness, with consideration of procedural fairness
Evidence_Used: Allegation of non-receipt of correspondence, description of family situation in Armenia
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 25(1) of IRPA (Humanitarian and Compassionate grounds)
Application_Basis: Humanitarian and compassionate considerations due to family hardship in Armenia
Evidence_Assessed: Officer failed to assess updated evidence due to lack of proper notice
Relief_Sought: Reconsideration of H&C application with procedural fairness
Governing_Rule: Duty of fairness requires reasonable opportunity to present case and proof of communication delivery
Evidentiary_Deficiency: No verification or tracking of sent correspondence
Outcome: Decision set aside; remitted for redetermination
Decisional_Body: Immigration Division / Visa Office responsible for H&C assessment
Harm_Assessment: Applicant deprived of fair opportunity to present compelling family circumstances
Cause_Description: Denial of H&C application due to lack of updated evidence about family situation in Armenia, resulting from procedural unfairness
Evidence_Handling: Failure to ensure applicant could submit updated evidence due to unverified communication method
Legal_Provision_Violated: Implied breach of procedural fairness under IRPA and administrative law principles
Evidence_Issues: Missing verification of delivery of request for updated information
Evidence_Assessment: Critical updates regarding family situation were not considered due to procedural flaw
Decision_Rationale: Decision cannot stand where applicant was not fairly informed of need for additional evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of proof of service or delivery of request for updated evidence
Legal_Standard_Applied: Duty of fairness in administrative processes
